TopicTitle: Can anyone recommend me some good and best free software for viewing X-ray images?

Articles.Content:
Recently, I was an X-ray of the right foot, because it hurt me terribly, it turned out that I have a heel spur, I was a little surprised because I always seemed to be that this disease of old people, but my doctor said it's because I'm fat :-(

 

But I am also something else, I used x-rays were done in Poland on the big plates, and unfortunately now are stored on CDs, I got it, and a description of x-rays of my feet.

I'd like to see what it looks like X-ray, and probably so I would from this do not understand, but I would like to know what it looks like thing causing my pain.

Its a bit image graphics file, try getting a graphics file covertervto open it. you could alsontry inserting it into a word document.
Try opening with gimp or other image manipulation suite, they should read lots of formats

Here Pawelk, try this. I've been using Irfanview for years and it can open just about anything.

http://www.irfanview.com/
